title: PEPPER: Introduction to R
text:
This site contains short, practical tutorials to help PEPPER group members build skills in R using RStudio and tidyverse-style code with the base R pipe |>.
Start with the first chapter or browse all tutorials from the sidebar.

title: R and Quarto: quick start
text:
This tutorial confirms your setup and shows how to run code chunks.
#| message: false # Base pipe with tidyverse conventions library(tidyverse)
tib <- tibble(x = 1:5, y = x^2) tib |> summarise(mean_x = mean(x), mean_y = mean(y))

title: Data manipulation with dplyr
text:
We will create a small data frame and compute grouped summaries.
#| message: false library(tidyverse) library(janitor)
df <- tibble( id = 1:8, group = c(“A”,“A”,“B”,“B”,“B”,“A”,“C”,“C”), value = c(3, 5, 2, 9, 4, 6, 1, 7) ) |> clean_names()
summary_tbl <- df |> group_by(group) |> summarise( n = n(), mean_value = mean(value), sd_value = sd(value), .groups = “drop” ) |> arrange(desc(mean_value))
summary_tbl

title: Visualisation with ggplot2
text:
We will plot the grouped means from the previous tutorial.
#| message: false library(tidyverse)
summary_tbl <- tibble( group = c(“A”,“B”,“C”), mean_value = c(4.67, 5.00, 4.00) )
summary_tbl |> ggplot(aes(x = group, y = mean_value)) + geom_col() + geom_text(aes(label = round(mean_value, 2)), vjust = -0.4) + labs( x = “Group”, y = “Mean value”, title = “Mean by group” ) + theme_minimal()

title: Linear models: a minimal example
text:
Fit and interpret a simple linear model.
#| message: false library(tidyverse) set.seed(1)
dat <- tibble( x = seq(0, 10, length.out = 50), y = 2 + 0.8 * x + rnorm(50, sd = 1.5) )
fit <- lm(y ~ x, data = dat) broom::tidy(fit) {r} Copy code # Visual check library(ggplot2)
dat |> ggplot(aes(x, y)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = “lm”, se = TRUE) + labs(title = “Linear fit”, x = “x”, y = “y”) + theme_minimal() {r} Copy code # Model summary and basic diagnostics broom::glance(fit)
